subject: RE: [junit] Question about JUnit 4 execution
msgSnippet: The answer to what I think is Milan s question is one for each method annotated with @Test . The order, James, is as you have pointed out. Regards, Kent Beck
messageBody:
The answer to what I think is Milan's question is "one for each method
annotated with @Test". The order, James, is as you have pointed out.

Regards,

Well, I just did a little experiment, which confirmed my intuitive
understanding of how it works.

public class TestBeforeClass {

public static MyClass ins;

public MyOtherClass oth;

@BeforeClass
public static void beforeAllMethod() {
// if I initialize "ins" static object here
ins = new MyClass();

// Is this "ins" object available in all @Test methods in the

}

@Before
public void before() {
// If I instantiate "oth" object here
oth = new MyOtherClass();

}

@After
public void after() {

}

@Test
public void testMethod() {
// I work here with my objects;
ins.someMethod();
oth.someMethod();
}

@Test
public void otherTestHere() {
ins.someMethod();
oth.someMethod();
}
}

And with appropriate System.out calls in constructors and methods:

MyClass.<init>
MyOtherClass.<init>
MyClass.someMethod
MyOtherClass.someMethod
MyOtherClass.<init>
MyClass.someMethod
MyOtherClass.someMethod

So @BeforeClass only gets called once, but @Before gets called before
each test, as you would expect,

Cheers,

James
